channel.title: Am I the only bored?
channel.description:
Below is a explanation of
The game isn't the same. Starting my memberships I knew it wouldn't be the same game and it will never be. The player base is smarter, there are still more unused areas than ever, bots are coming back strong, and [b]there aren't any rare items[/b]. There's a lot of new content in the game that I just hate, and I remembered it being way better in 2006. The first week of release, all I could think about was RuneScape and how much fun I was going to have, but now two weeks have gone by and I'm very bored.
Rare items were a HUGE part of the game for me during the prime of RS. It gave you something to work for, if you had a partyhat you [i]were[/i] better than the player who didn't. Yeah, whips and barrows are rare but eventually those will become more common.
There's content in the game that does not belong with this "old school" era. What people don't understand about the newer content is the graphic style, the models made in 2007-2008 were foreshadowing the HD update and keeping them in the game now only throws off 'the graphical balance' of the game. (I don't like the new Varrock and I can't stand the current GameFrame).
Which all some how tie together with me being bored. I am hopeful for the weekly content polls Jagex will be giving us which is all I can hope for really. As my nostalgia dies, so does the game.

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

I don’t like pking, neither am I bored. I love all aspects of this game and don’t mind the lacking rares as I don’t even have enough to buy any of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Pure pking is shit. Nine times out of ten your best drop will be a dds. If you’re lucky you’ll get black chaps as well.
And to top it off, you automatically disqualify yourself from mage bank pking (because let’s face it, two or three level 126s rock up and it’s game over).

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:23, topic:507188”]I think another reason for my severe boredom is that I chose the pure route again. I’ve made like 5 different pure accounts, and my last one had 99 stats so doing it all over again is very boring.

Probably will get defence and rape sini[/quote]

I will one v one you any day and gf you noob

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

the elve age:

There’s content in the game that does not belong with this “old school” era. What people don’t understand about the newer content is the graphic style, the models made in 2007-2008 were foreshadowing the HD update and keeping them in the game now only throws off ‘the graphical balance’ of the game. (I don’t like the new Varrock and I can’t stand the current GameFrame).

Yeah, thats one thing I have noticed with this time of revision
its like semi old school, or a hybrid between hd and oldschool, because of some updated npc models, and new places like varrock etc
Honestly it just doesnt look good with it, there isnt that many models they’d need to change to take it back completely, other than varrock that may take a bit of time I don’t see a problem with stuff like changing dragons, wolfs, demons, varrock guards, varrock in general (including the fountain :o), giants, so on so forth

But other than that really its pretty fun to me at least

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Aren’t rares planned for microtransactions?

Anyhow, I played a lot when it first came out but I simply do not have the interest to play. I tried to play legit and not for gold but that lasted about two days before I started selling, and since the price is mud now I’m not even bothering. However, I do plan on playing a fair bit over summer. I would really like to max my stats and hopefully I’ll have more interest.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

I’m not finding myself bored, I do think that rares will make a comeback into the game but not this very instant, they need to build on ideas rather than just randomly hand them out to players.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I only wanted to play RS2007 to have a chance at being on the top of the highscores, but that was an epic fail for myself. I only believe there is no point in grinding skills and spending countless hours on something unless you love the hype of being in the top few or you are just an achievement hoarder.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

Can’t say I’m bored but if rares are not introduced I really don’t see how anything is suppose to hold any value other than the alch price.

The same way things hold value in every other economy ever (real and virtual) – supply and demand. Although alchemy was always stupid because it effectively set arbitrary price ceilings/floors. I bet they’ll never make a mistake like that again (but only because they’ll never develop another successful game. :D)

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

the elve age:

I’ve told you why Magic Seeds are “high priced”, that’s the HARDEST seed to get in the game aside Spirit Tree. Of course people are going to sell them for higher prices, growing your own magic tree when magic logs are 1.5kea? And I highly disagree with the predictable pking and how you never die. I mean yeah you never die if you eat above half health and eat when they spec.

If 1/10 of the population has a magic seed… then that’s a lot of magic seeds in the game. If inflation was natural they would be cheap right now but everyone already knows the value of that item. I don’t really care since I can find sellers @ 20-30k each and already have several of them saved. It’s just everyone knows the values of items where before you had no idea an amulet of accuracy was going to be 10-20k.

I haven’t died in a 1v1 in about 5 years (this is f2p pking btw)

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Can’t say I’m bored but if rares are not introduced I really don’t see how anything is suppose to hold any value other than the alch price.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:6, topic:507188”]It’s frustrating because new people are in charge on the game now (the people who have whips, mills, etc etc). The problem is everyone already knows how to ‘tackle’ the game. Which is why I decided to create that clan to shift rolls and make things more efficient (which the top guys did with no lives). Everyone knows a magic seed is going to be 100k (although us farmers don’t really care for them) people still are stuck on the old prices.

Back in the day it wasn’t really this greedy. I use to give out free law runes to people in need, answer questions, and sometimes let the person I am about to kill get away. Since people already know what to expect they become greedy bastards.

The thrill of the game (to me) is pking. Always has been, always will be. In rs2, pking does suck because again… everyone knows what to expect. It sucks because I predict peoples moves so easily that I hardly die, which becomes boring. Oh here he goes with the dspec, if he hits good he will try again after I eat my shark. Everyone knows how to create a pure which really defeats the purpose. I remember back in rsc I had no clue what a monk pure was. I really wish those monk pures were still around. They are awesome.[/quote]I’ve told you why Magic Seeds are “high priced”, that’s the HARDEST seed to get in the game aside Spirit Tree. Of course people are going to sell them for higher prices, growing your own magic tree when magic logs are 1.5kea? And I highly disagree with the predictable pking and how you never die. I mean yeah you never die if you eat above half health and eat when they spec.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Its hard training from scratch again I just caught up with my combat stats on my EOC account which is awesome but I only play to keep myself on the highscores. Being top 500-600 in any of the skills now requires you play at least 2-3 hours a day. Its annoying at times.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

I tend to agree also. I have no problem with the EoC and had no real plans to leave it but I did make a new account to test out the 2007 servers and see how it goes. After the first couple of days I lost a great deal of interest due to not a lot being in the game. Sure pking will be fun and all but like what was already said it gets predictable when you’ve been doing it for years prior. Not saying I knew this was going to happen but when a lot of people started planning out “strategies” on how to play the new servers it all sounded like a bad idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:7, topic:507188”]The biggest problem is that it’s almost like we’re all playing a game we were given 10 years to study and practice. Everyone knows the best methods already so it isn’t the same, nothing new will be discovered for the most part.[/quote]my thoughts exactly

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

It’s frustrating because new people are in charge on the game now (the people who have whips, mills, etc etc). The problem is everyone already knows how to ‘tackle’ the game. Which is why I decided to create that clan to shift rolls and make things more efficient (which the top guys did with no lives). Everyone knows a magic seed is going to be 100k (although us farmers don’t really care for them) people still are stuck on the old prices.

Back in the day it wasn’t really this greedy. I use to give out free law runes to people in need, answer questions, and sometimes let the person I am about to kill get away. Since people already know what to expect they become greedy bastards.

The thrill of the game (to me) is pking. Always has been, always will be. In rs2, pking does suck because again… everyone knows what to expect. It sucks because I predict peoples moves so easily that I hardly die, which becomes boring. Oh here he goes with the dspec, if he hits good he will try again after I eat my shark. Everyone knows how to create a pure which really defeats the purpose. I remember back in rsc I had no clue what a monk pure was. I really wish those monk pures were still around. They are awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

the community will never be the same, and the actual “07 feeling” will never be there 100%. I must admit though we have all learned so much since our first step in runescape so many years ago.

I personally am playing 07 just to test how far I can really get and how good I have gotten with questing compared to my original character on eoc rs.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I find myself becoming less productive and having a more relaxed game style.
I’ll usually be found cutting maples, and then periodically wander off and start chatting with either friends or people in banks.
Though, I really don’t feel worthy of complaining, considering Jagex had actually managed to give us what we had wanted all along; an ‘oldschool’ era of the game.
Now, seeing that you miss rares being incorporated into the game, I can’t say that I can agree completely. They always gave a very public air of cockiness which I didn’t always appreciate. Yet, for them to be back into the game would give me something to work for.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I the only bored?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:2, topic:507188”]Still been really fun for me. I wasn’t just playing it for nostalgia (though there has been a bit), the game’s a lot easier to understand and a lot more fun than current RS. I have enough things to strive for besides rares right now so that hasn’t been an issue, but they are going to hold polls for how rares should be released soon.[/quote]Most of the ideas revolve around every player having them, or players get a “chance” all the time to get them (like as a rare drop).

Read full topic

I have enough things to strive for besides rares right now so that hasn’t been an issue, but they are going to hold polls for how rares should be released soon.
